wikipedia_page.main: William Maxwell Simmers (7 August 1904 in Glasgow – 14 November 1972 in Helensburgh) was a Scottish rugby union player. He was often referred to as "Max" and/or "Bill". He was the 70th President of the Scottish Rugby Union.

response: *  Max Simmers, (first capped 1926) - 28 caps  - SRU President 1956-57

As a schoolboy he played for Glasgow Academicals and represented Scotland Schools. His father Brian Simmers and grandfather Max Simmers both played for Glasgow Academicals and both represented Scotland. His father Brian was a chairman of Glasgow Academicals and founded the Glasgow Hawks side on Accies and Glasgow High Kelvinside merger in 1997.

response: *Brian Simmers and Max Simmers; Brian is Max's son
